Package organisers

Class AuctionHouse

java.lang.Object
organisers.AuctionHouse
public class AuctionHouse
extends java.lang.Object
The AuctionHouse class is based on the Singleton Design Pattern and holds all the fields necessary for the auctions

    • readProducts

      public void readProducts()
      Method for reading all the products, used by the clients when signing up

    • request

      public void request​(Client c, int productId, double maxPrice) throws UnknownProductException, DuplicateRequestException, InvalidProductRequest
      Register a request by a specific client, for a specific product, with the maximum price specified. If the product requested has an auction that can be started, then start an auction, and log a string representation of the auction process
      Parameters:
      c - The client that makes the request
      productId - the product requested by him
      maxPrice - the maximum price the client is willing to offer for the product
      Throws:
      UnknownProductException - if the product is not found
      DuplicateRequestException - if the request has already been sent
      InvalidProductRequest - if the sum offered is too small

    • getProducts

      public java.util.List<Product> getProducts()

    • getAuctions

      public java.util.List<Auction> getAuctions()

    • getSoldProducts

      public java.util.List<Product> getSoldProducts()

    • findProduct

      public Product findProduct​(int productId, double maxPrice) throws UnknownProductException, InvalidProductRequest
      Searches a product by ID and verifies if the maxPrice is bigger than the product's minimum price
      Parameters:
      productId - the product's ID
      maxPrice - the maximum price offered by the client
      Returns:
      the Product found
      Throws:
      UnknownProductException - if the product is not found
      InvalidProductRequest - if the sum offered is too small

    • getClients

      public java.util.List<Client> getClients()
      Gets the list of clients
      Returns:
      the list of clients signed up in this house
